data.enText: a strong feeling of shock and anger
The judge's remarks caused public outrage.
Environmentalists have expressed outrage at the ruling.
data.chText: 环境保护主义者对这一裁决表示愤慨。

data.enText: an act or event that is violent, cruel or very wrong and that shocks people or makes them very angry
No one has yet claimed responsibility for this latest bomb outrage.
data.chText: 迄今还没有人宣称对最近的爆炸丑行负责。

data.enText: to make sb very shocked and angry
He was outraged at the way he had been treated.
data.chText: 他对所遭受的待遇感到非常愤怒。

ex.enText: He trembled with rage on hearing the news.
ex.chText: 他听到这个消息时气得浑身发抖。

ex.enText: Don't answer back when she is in a rage.
ex.chText: 她发火的时候不要顶嘴。

synonyms.bx: 指强烈的、难以控制的怒气。

ex.enText: She felt great anger about it.
She struggled to control her anger at the waiter's arrogance.
ex.chText: 对于服务生的傲慢，她拼命压住怒火。

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，多指因受到不公平或不友善的对待、顶撞等而引起的愤怒，常后接介词 at。

ex.enText: A look of annoyance crossed her face when she knew that her boyfriend couldn't come back before Christmas Eve.
ex.chText: 得知男朋友平安夜前无法赶回来，她的脸上掠过一丝恼怒的神情。

ex.enText: To their annoyance, she was late again.
ex.chText: 让他们气恼的是，她又迟到了。

ex.enText: Old Green flew into a fury.
In her fury she tore the letter to pieces.
ex.chText: 她盛怒之下把信撕得粉碎。

ex.enText: Negotiation details were leaked to the press, much to the manager's fury.
ex.chText: 谈判细节被泄露给了媒体，令经理大为光火。

synonyms.bx: 指极端愤怒，如大发雷霆、暴跳如雷，常伴有粗暴行为。

ex.enText: The pollution event generated public outrage.
ex.chText: 这起污染事件激起了公众的愤怒。

ex.enText: The company turned a blind eye to the local residents' outrage at its plan to develop the coastline.
ex.chText: 该公司无视当地居民对其沿海地区开发计划的愤慨。

synonyms.bx: 指强烈的愤怒和震惊，常后接介词 at/over。

ex.enText: She was afraid of provoking her mother's wrath.
ex.chText: 她害怕惹母亲大发雷霆。

synonyms.bx: 指极为恼怒，含欲施加惩罚或报复之意。

example: The scandalous behavior of this married woman shocked her friends

tr: force (someone) to have sex against their will
example: The woman was raped on her way home at night

tr: violate the sacred character of a place or language
example: violate the sanctity of the church

value.boxr_value: The verb is pronounced /ˌaʊt'reɪdʒ/. The noun is pronounced /'aʊtreɪdʒ/. 动词读作 /ˌaʊt'reɪdʒ/，名词读作 /'aʊtreɪdʒ/。

example.ex: Many people have been outraged by some of the things that have been said...
example.tran: 其中的一些言论激怒了很多人。

example.ex: Reports of torture and mass executions in Serbia's detention camps have outraged the world's religious leaders.
example.tran: 关于塞尔维亚拘留营里动用酷刑并大肆处决的报道令全世界的宗教领袖义愤填膺。

value.def: If you are outraged by something, it makes you extremely shocked and angry.

example.ex: He is truly outraged about what's happened to him...
example.tran: 这一遭遇实在让他满腔愤慨。

example.ex: Some outraged readers said the story was extremely offensive and distressing.
example.tran: 一些感到义愤的读者说这篇报道极为令人反感，而且非常伤人。

example.ex: The decision provoked outrage from women and human rights groups...
example.tran: 这一决定激起了妇女和人权组织的强烈愤慨。

example.ex: The Treaty has failed to arouse genuine public outrage.
example.tran: 该协定并未真正激起公愤。

value.def: Outrage is an intense feeling of anger and shock.

example.ex: The latest outrage was to have been a co-ordinated gun and bomb attack on the station...
example.tran: 最近的一起暴行是同时动用了枪支和炸弹的对车站的袭击。

value.def: You can refer to an act or event which you find very shocking as an outrage .
